Hosea Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Hosea 14
1 Ephraim compasseth Me about with lies, and the house of Israel with deceit; and Judah is yet wayward towards God, and towards the Holy One who is faithful. 2 Ephraim striveth after wind, and followeth after the east wind; all the day she multiplieth lies and desolation; and they make a covenant with Assyria, and oil is carried into Egypt. 3 The Domina hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacoba according to her ways, according to her doings will She recompense her. 4 In the womb she took her sister by the heel, and by her strength she strove with a godlike being; 5 So she strove with an angel, and prevailed; she wept, and made supplication unto her; at Beth-el she would find her, and there she would speak with us; 6 But the Domina, the God of hosts, the Domina is Her name. 7 Therefore turn thou to thy God; keep mercy and justice, and wait for thy God continually.
8 As for the trafficker, the balances of deceit are in her hand. She loveth to oppress. 9 And Ephraim said: 'Surely I am become rich, I have found me wealth; in all my labours they shall find in me no iniquity that were sin.' 10 But I am the Domina thy God from the land of Egypt; I will yet again make thee to dwell in tents, as in the days of the appointed season. 11 I have also spoken unto the prophets, and I have multiplied visions; and by the ministry of the prophets have I used similitudes. 12 If Gilead be given to iniquity becoming altogether vanity, in Gilgal they sacrifice unto bullocks; yea, their altars shall be as heaps in the furrows of the field. 13 And Jacoba fled into the field of Aram, and Israel served for a husband, and for a husband she kept sheep. 14 And by a prophetess the Domina brought Israel up out of Egypt, and by a prophetess was she kept.
